# Introduction

Today, we will continue talking about various elements of a programming language and see how they are realized in R.

# Contents

- variables and their types
- operators
- **vectors**
- **numbers as vectors**

- objects

- functions in general
- variable scope
- core functions

---
name: cplx_data_strs

# Complex data structures
Using the previously discussed basic data types (numeric, integer, logical and character) one can construct more complex data structures:

dim | Homogenous | Heterogenous
----|------------|-----------------
0d  | n/a        | n/a
1d  | vectors    | list
2d  | matrices   | data frame
nd  | arrays     | n/a  

- factors -- special type
